name: Leander "Lee" Stinson
bio:
Leander is believed to be a middle name. It is believed that his first name was James. He was taken prisoner at Fort Morgan, AL and transported to the Elmira Union POW Camp in New York where he died of chronic diarrhea.

The Elmira Union POW Camp in Elmira, New York, was a notoriously harsh Civil War prison for Confederate soldiers, known as "Hellmira," with a high death rate (around 24%) due to disease, overcrowding, and harsh winters, comparable to the infamous Andersonville. Operating from 1864 to 1865, it held over 12,000 prisoners, nearly 3,000 of whom died from poor conditions, making it the deadliest Union prison camp.

The camp's prisoners are buried in the National Cemetery at Elmira Prison Camp.

When Leander Lee Stinson was born in 1824, in South Carolina, United States, his father, Andrew Stinson, was 32 and his mother, Elizabeth Stringfellow, was 33. He married Nancy Lynn Pinkerton (Burkett?) in 1845, in Butler, Alabama, United States. They were the parents of at least 4 sons and 1 daughter. He lived in Butler, Alabama, United States for about 10 years. In 1850, at the age of 26, his occupation is listed as farmer in Butler, Alabama, United States. He died on 11 February 1865, in Elmira, Chemung, New York, United States, at the age of 41, and was buried in Woodlawn National Cemetery, Elmira, Chemung, New York, United States.
